pull.title: Remove ambiguity in construction of prevector
pull.body: The call with this default argument is redundant with `prevector(size_type)` on line 251.

verification.payload:
tree f342c6257ba3817f708acc22f16244101b9faeae
parent 271b379e636afa419c5208cb462c07090490266c
author Ben Woosley <ben.woosley@gmail.com> 1535018259 -0700
committer Ben Woosley <ben.woosley@gmail.com> 1535018259 -0700

Remove default argument to prevector constructor to remove ambiguity

The call with this default argument is redundant with prevector(size_type).

events.message:
Remove default argument to prevector constructor to remove ambiguity

The call with this default argument is redundant with prevector(size_type).

rename.from: Remove default argument to prevector constructor to remove ambiguity
rename.to: Remove ambiguity in construction of prevector

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->Note to reviewers: This pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #14028 (Explicitly initialize prevector _union by Empact)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

utACK 497e90c02b96e8739e8faf3d43e41ba1ff0627b7.

For reference, with c++11, std::vector's matching constructor also removed its default argument and dropped the explicit qualifier.

issue.title: [port] update prevector.h
issue.body:
`prevector.h`:

```c++
/** Implements a drop-in replacement for std::vector<T> which stores up to N
 *  elements directly (without heap allocation). The types Size and Diff are
 *  used to store element counts, and can be any unsigned + signed type.
 *  ...
 **/
```

This is mainly due to bring to the project the perf gain and fixed that this subsys received by the means of this series of Core PRs:

bitcoin/bitcoin#12324
bitcoin/bitcoin#14715
bitcoin/bitcoin#14651
bitcoin/bitcoin#14266
bitcoin/bitcoin#14028
bitcoin/bitcoin#14030
bitcoin/bitcoin#12549
bitcoin/bitcoin#9856
bitcoin/bitcoin#11151

comments.body: The `explicit` keyword is also redundant for constructions with >1 argument.

FYI: looks like this will change post C++11:
https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/explicit
https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/converting_constructor

Neat!

It's not really relevant here, but I'll expand on @Empact's comment because it's something I didn't know, maybe others will benefit as well.

Post c++11:
```c++
    using ScriptType = prevector<28, unsigned char>;
    ScriptType vec{1, 255};   // always works
    vec = ScriptType{1, 255}; // always works
    vec = {1, 255};           // only works if prevector's ctor is not explicit.
```
caveat: the 3rd example above does not actually work because of prevector's templated iterator ctor, but that's unrelated.
